result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carter Joshua Pionk

records.addlTxt: State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
8:17 AM Defendant Carter Joshua Pionk in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Carter Joshua Pionk.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. State calls Detective Sean Holmgren. Detective Holmgren sworn and testified. State direct examination of Detective Holmgren. Witness identifies defendant. State rests. State makes argument for bind over. Attorney Nelsen makes argument in opposition of bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for arraignment. Court sets arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Carter Joshua Pionk
Current: 4504 149th Ct, Apple Valley, MN 55124 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: 3055 S Chicago Av, Oliver, WI 54880
No contact with GS or his residence.  No use or possession of a dangerous weapon

1:39pm Defendant Carter Joshua Pionk appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Michael Hoffman appearing special via zoom. Attorney Peter Kruger appears for the State of Wisconsin
Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. 
State requesting 25,000cb No contact with GS who is listed as victim 1 in complaint. No use or possession of a dangerous weapon. 
Address not local; gave Oliver address, was on supervision while committing this offense. MN convictions; unsure if he's still on supervision for this offense.
Court quashes warrant.
Attorney Hoffman questions defendant; defendant doesn't remember address he was living in. Most of his family lives in Douglas County, was employed at call center. Has not missed court.
Court cites concerns and significant possible prison exposure for charges.  Seriousness of charges.  No alleged fta's.
Court orders $10,000 cb No contact with GS or his residence.  No use or possession of a dangerous weapon. Court notes that GS is listed as victim 1 in the complaint.
Court questions defendant on intent to counsel and explains waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant requests to keep preliminary hearing on for 10/5
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
